definition: to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Use comma to separate and distinguish additional or incidental information inserted into a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 使用逗号分割插入语和主句成分。

sentences.english: What is more, parenthesis is difficult for foreign students to study spoken Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 同时，插入语也是外国学生学习汉语口语的一大难点。

sentences.english: A parenthetical clause or phrase is one that can be removed without changing the meaning of the sentence or making it ungrammatical.
sentences.chinese: 插入语是一个句子中即使被删掉也不影响句子的部分。

sentences.english: We restricted our study to three-letter abbreviations which were defined using parenthetical expressions.
sentences.chinese: 我们限制我们的研究到使用插入语的三字母缩写上。

sentences.english: This phrase is often used as a parenthesis, which appears at the beginning or in the middle of a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 这个短句一般用做插入语，位于句首或句中。

definition: inversion (rhetoric device of inverting the word order for heightened effect)/anastrophe
